instructions.1: Press peppercorns into both sides of veal medallions. (They will not completely coat the veal.) Season with salt.
instructions.2: Heat 1 1/2 teaspoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the veal and cook until golden outside and faintly pink inside, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate and tent with foil to keep warm.
instructions.3: Add the remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons oil to the pan. Add shallot and cook, stirring, until softened, about 1 minute. Add juice, vinegar and tomato paste. Bring to a boil, scraping up any browned bits. Cook until the liquid is reduced by half, about 4 minutes. Stir in scallions and any accumulated juices from the veal. Season with salt. Divide the veal among 4 plates and top with the sauce. Serve immediately.

questions.question: In Step 3, is the veal from Step 1 being used?
Is veal from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is veal from Step 1 still available in Step 2?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 3?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to add the veal in Step 2?
Can we press (Step 1) and add (Step 3) at the same time?
